llama-2-7b-chat-hf_fact: Graduated compression stockings (GCS) are designed to apply pressure to the legs, graded from the knee to the thigh.
GCS are used to help reduce the risk of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) by promoting blood flow and reducing the risk of blood stagnation.
A study by the Clinical Epidemiology Unit at the University of Edinburgh found no reduction in the incidence of DVT with the use of GCS in hospitalized patients with acute stroke.
The study by the University of Edinburgh was published in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA) in 1998.
A study published in the Journal of Vascular Surgery in 2010 found that the use of GCS significantly reduced the incidence of DVT in hospitalized patients with acute stroke.
